text: Is it good style to call bash commands within a Python script using os.system("bash code")?
I was wondering whether or not it is considered a good style to call bash commands within a Python script using os.system().
I was also wondering whether or not it is safe to do so as well.
I know how to implement some of the functionality I need in Bash and in Python, but it is much simpler and more intuitive to implement it in Bash.
However, I feel like it is very hackish to write os.system("bash code").
Specifically, I want to move all files that end with a certain extension to a directory.
In this case, what should I do?
